titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Frederick H. Chatfield papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Beaudry R. Allen

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-10-29T08:53-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

physdesc.extent: 2 oversize boxes, 1 oversize folder, 2 envelopes, 1 framed certificate

did.abstract: Photographs, printed matter and memorabilia, relating to relief activities of the Commission for Relief in Belgium during World War I.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Frederick H. Chatfield papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1953.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the library catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Frederick H. Chatfield was a member of the Commission for Relief in Belgium (CRB). Chatfield served as secetary of the Cincinnati branch and was the CRB delegate for the Commission du Lait of Le Comité de Secours et d'Alimentation de l’Arrondissement de Liège, a relief committee trying to provide food and establish dairy production centers in Liège during World War I.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collection(s)
relatedmaterial.p: Commission for Relief in Belgium Records, 1914-1930, Hoover Institution Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photographs, lithographs, printed matter, and memorabilia, relating to relief activities of the Commission for Relief in Belgium and Comité de Secours et d'Alimentation de l’Arrondissement de Liège during World War I. The collection is arranged by medium into three series: Photographs, Printed materials, and Memorabilia.

controlaccess.corpname: Commission for Relief in Belgium (1914-1930)--Pictorial works.
controlaccess.subject: International relief.
World War, 1914-1918--Belgium.
World War, 1914-1918--Civilian relief.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs include members of the Commission for Relief in Belgium and Comité de secours et d'Alimentation de l’Arrondissement de Liège.

did.unittitle: C.R.B office in Liège, R. Arrowsmith and others, undated
Le Comité de Secours et d’Alimentation de la Province de Liège, June 1916
Le Comité de Secours et d’Alimentation de la Province de Liège, 22 February 1915
"Élèves de l’école moyenne professionnelle de demoiselles de la ville de Liège," August 1916
Comité de Secours et d’Alimentation de la Province de Liège, 22 February 1915

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains lithographs, scrapbook, and printed matter relating to the Comité de Secours et d'Alimentation de l’Arrondissement de Liège activities. The scrapbook includes news-clippings relating to Chatfield's CRB work and the United States' lending pledge to the CRB. Arranged by format.

did.unittitle: Le Comité National de Secours et d’Alimentation, lithograph, with identity chart, 1914-1918
The History of the CRB, by Tracy Kittredge, 1918
Rapport de la Commission du Lait, 1919
Scraps of Paper: German Proclamations in Belgium and France , undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains decorated flour sacks relating to CRB flour distribution in Belgium and a framed certificate.

did.unittitle: Flour sacks. 1 embroidered design and 2 painted designs
